resources.string: Mozi is not connected! Make sure your Bluetooth is on and try connecting.
We help you order parts and build your very own Mozi.
With Google Blockly, you can program Mozi to follow your commands.
Show off and share your work by uploading to our website.
You can tap on my components to learn more about them. If you\'re not sure where to tap, long press around me to get a hint!

This is my Arduino. It works for me like a brain by telling my wheels how to spin, my lights when to light up, and can even become a brain for other neat projects! \n\nYou might have a generic ATmega328P board—that works, too!

My breadboard and jumper wires go together so that electricity can flow so I can move and light up. Be sure you connect my wires correctly, though—the current flowing through the Arduino isn\'t strong enough to shock you, but it could fry me!
My mini servos are a type of motor that can be let me move forward, backward, and even turn, depending on how you program me!
My battery pack is where I can get my power from, so my brain can function and I can GO! I use the same sort of batteries you use in your toys.

When I first come to life, I need my USB OTG cable so that a creation message can get sent from your Android device to me. After that first set-up, I can receive messages via Bluetooth, no wires needed!
My ultrasonic range finder works like your "eyes". It looks like them too! But instead of using light it uses tiny sound waves to help me see, letting me detect what is near me!
LED stands for light-emitting diode. LEDs are my lights that you can program to flash in different ways!
My resistors let me control my energy so that I can put it to good use!
